channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How to Start Investing for Retirement: 401(k), IRA, Roth?
item.description: The IRA vs. 401(k). You’ve heard of these retirement accounts before, but do you know the difference between the two? Maybe you have a 401(k) at work and have been […]

item.title: nOps lands $30M to optimize AWS customers’ cloud spend
item.description: nOps sells software designed to "optimize" the budgets that businesses allocate to cloud products and services. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How a Drop in Border Crossings May Change the Presidential Campaign
item.description: The Democratic National Convention sought to address one of the party’s biggest weaknesses with voters.

item.title: Corporate HQ Relocations Could Signal the Next Real Estate Boomtowns
item.description: Are the next boomtowns being sought out by large corporations ahead of time? Do they know something you don't?

item.title: Paris court explains why it’s arrested Telegram founder, Pavel Durov
item.description: When Pavel Durov, founder and CEO of messaging app Telegram, was arrested on August 24, French authorities did not respond to requests for comment. The secrecy of pre-trial investigations and inquiries is an important principle in the French judicial system. French television network TF1 reported that the main issues are Telegram’s (lack of) moderation processes […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Prosecutors Fight Exonerations
item.description: As laws are passed to support the wrongfully convicted, some officials in the legal system push back.

item.title: Evaluating Kamala Harris’s Proposals For the Real Estate Industry
item.description: Andrew Syrios gives his analysis of the impact of Vice President Harris's economic plans on the real estate industry, if she's elected president this November.

item.title: Google’s AI overviews in Hindi need a quality upgrade
item.description: Given India’s language diversity, digital content companies already face a challenge in trying to show and translate content accurately. Google is facing a similar problem with AI overviews recently rolled out in the country. The company introduced Hindi support for AI overviews in the country earlier in August. Users in India can also switch between […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: FAQ: How The Marshall Project Is Covering the 2024 Election
item.description: Learn more about who we are and how we choose what political stories to cover.

item.title: There Are More Renters Than Homeowners in Wealthy States—Why?
item.description: Isn't it supposed to be easier to buy a home when you make more money? The data suggests that it's actually harder in many wealthier states.

item.title: African B2B e-commerce startups Wasoko and MaxAB complete merger: Interview with co-CEO Daniel Yu
item.description: Two of Africa's largest B2B e-commerce platforms, Wasoko and MaxAB, have finally completed the continent’s much-talked-about merger. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Mother on a Mission for Full Police Transparency
item.description: Troy, Alabama, police severely beat Ulysses Wilkerson when he was 17. Seven years later, his mom, Angela Williams, is still fighting for answers.

item.title: Bankruptcy to Financial Freedom in Under 10 Years with a $1M+ Net Worth
item.description: From bankruptcy to financial freedom in just ten years?! Today’s guest is living proof that past money mistakes don’t disqualify you from building wealth with real estate. Whether you’re neck-deep […]

item.title: Calendar tool Clockwise adds new AI-powered interface called Prism
item.description: Clockwise is changing up its interface with an AI-powered assistant called Prism that lets you manage calendar invites and scheduling with text prompts. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How the 1968 DNC in Chicago Devolved into ‘Unrestrained and Indiscriminate Police Violence’
item.description: As protesters prepare for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago next week, a half-century old report provides lessons for preventing chaos.
